instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT is the voltage rail for the backlight of the LCD screen. .
definitions.LCD_BKLT_PWM: What is LCD_BKLT_PWM? LCD_BKLT_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..
definitions.D9701: What is D9701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.BKL_EN: What is BKL_EN? BKL_EN enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Board is water damage, on inicial inspection I detect that <RESISTOR>R0910</RESISTOR> is bad, I also replace the BL driver <CHIP>U9701</CHIP>, tons of crap under the IC.

Now I have 12.5V in <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> all the way to pins 21 and 22 of J9000.

Have measure all resistence around the driver and all readings are fine. 

Line <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL> in 0V, not sure what value I need in that line.

Any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Do you have image, only missing backlight?
Do few PRAM resets first.

Post <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL> level.
If OK, then remove <RESISTOR>R9704</RESISTOR> and run a wire from <RESISTOR>R9715</RESISTOR> to <CAPACITOR>C9704</CAPACITOR>.
If still no backlight, post diode mode to ground on all (6) return pins of LCD connector.
Be sure both pins of <DIODE>D9701</DIODE> have continuity to <CHIP>U9701</CHIP>; especially FB line.
Also check if <DIODE>D9701</DIODE> is not shorted A-K.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Mark as solved.

<RESISTOR>R9731</RESISTOR> was bad and rolling me, because for some reason when I measure resistance it read 300K ohms, but <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL> was OV, now is 3V and BL is working fine.

As always thanks, was your suggestion what repair this mac.

Muchas gracias.
